title: PSI_YÉKIT 1.0 Dataset: Municipal-level water risk indicators for the Jequitinhonha Valley, Brazil (2015-2024)
description:
The PSI_YÉKIT 1.0 Dataset provides monthly, municipality-level indicators for water-related systemic risk in the Jequitinhonha Valley (Minas Gerais, Brazil) from 2015-01 to 2024-12.

The dataset organizes observable variables into four dimensions:

  • H (Hazard): Precipitation, temperature, drought indices (SPI).
  • E (Exposure): Total population, rural population, water access.
  • V (Vulnerability): Per capita income, poverty rate, infant mortality rate.
  • L (Land use upstream): Eucalyptus plantation area upstream.

The dataset also includes a latent variable Ψ(t) (systemic risk state), which is not directly observed but inferred by the PSI_YÉKIT Bayesian state-space model. Ψ(t) is distributed in a separate file (psi_latent.csv) to emphasize its inferred nature.

Key features:

  • Coverage: 2015-01 to 2024-12, municipalities in the Jequitinhonha Valley.
  • Format: Tidy/long CSV (UTF-8, comma-separated, decimal point).
  • Anonymization: k-anonymity (k ≥ 5) compliance with Brazil's LGPD (Lei Geral de Proteção de Dados).
  • Quality flags: Each record includes a quality_flag (observed, estimated, interpolated, calculated, suppressed, census).
  • Provenance: Full documentation of sources, derivation methods, and transformations.

Files included:

  • psi_yekit_v1_observables.csv — Observable variables (H, E, V, L)
  • psi_yekit_v1_psi_latent.csv — Latent state Ψ(t) (inferred)
  • DATA_DICTIONARY.csv — Complete data dictionary
  • sources_metadata.csv — Metadata of data sources
  • units_metadata.csv — Metadata of units of measurement
  • checksums_sha256.txt — SHA-256 checksums

Documentation:

  • README_DATA.md — Usage guide and warnings about Ψ latent variable
  • ANONYMIZATION.md — LGPD/k-anonymity procedures and quality flag vocabulary
  • PROVENANCE.md — Traceability and derivation decisions

Associated software: PSI_YÉKIT Bayesian model (DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.SOFTWARE_DOI_AQUI)

Citation: Yékit (2026). PSI_YÉKIT 1.0 Dataset: Municipal-level water risk indicators for the Jequitinhonha Valley, Brazil (2015-2024). Zenodo. DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.DATASET_DOI_AQUI

notes:
This dataset was created to support the PSI_YÉKIT Bayesian state-space model for estimating systemic water risk in the Jequitinhonha Valley, Brazil. All data are anonymized following k-anonymity (k ≥ 5) and aggregated at the municipality-month level. The latent variable Ψ(t) is inferred by the model and should not be used as a direct empirical measurement. For details on the model, see the associated software repository.
